FuncDef:
The source-ip-validate list command specifies a destination IP address in an IP address verification list.
The undo source-ip-validate list command deletes a destination IP address from an IP address verification list.
By default, no destination IP address is specified in an IP address verification list.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a destination IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Source IP address verification secures MPLS-in-UDP tunnels. To specify a destination IP address in an IP address verification list, run the source-ip-validate list command.
Follow-up Procedure
Note the following when configuring this command:
Run the source-ip command in the MPLS-in-UDP-list view to specify a source IP address in an IP address verification list.Run the validate-list enable command in the MPLS-in-UDP-list view to enable source IP address verification. After the function is enabled and the device receives an MPLS-in-UDP packet, the device verifies the source IP address. The device discards the packet if the verification fails.
